sentence.text: Pyridoxine 5*-phosphate oxidase (pyridoxal phosphate biosynthetic process) is an enzyme that converts pyridoxine 5*-phosphate into pyridoxal 5*-phosphate (PLP), an active form of vitamin B6 implicated in several types of cancer.
However, the role of pyridoxal phosphate biosynthetic process and its regulatory mechanism in epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC) are unknown.
In the present study, pyridoxal phosphate biosynthetic process expression in human ovarian tumour tissue and its association with the clinicopathological features of patients with EOC were examined.
Xenografts of pyridoxal phosphate biosynthetic process-shRNA-expressing cells into the nude mouse attenuated tumour growth.
